I have been wearing water shoes to my gym to workout.  I purchased these shoes and they are as I expected them to be, lightweight, sturdy and great looking. 评论概述: Good value for money - you get what you pay for
评论详情: Price caught me as I was looking to replace my go to Merrell trail gloves.  I was looking for some minimal trail shoes to play disc golf -- for the price of these I figured why not try.  + Super light + Super minimal + Fit similar to the Merrell trail gloves -- albeit not as snug  - not very durable -- first day wearing to disc golf and made a bad pivot off tee pads and ripped hole on top of left shoe. Fabric on top is super thin. Left foot started sole started separating after about month. Right started separating about 7 months in. I wore these shoes solely disc golfing. So maybe an average of 3-4 times a month, typically 3-4 miles. Bought in Dec 2023 and they lasted til Aug 2024 before I replaced.  Overall not bad considering the price. That being said better for light trail duty. Light hikes and nothing I'd consider for trail running -- I don't trust they'll last long taking a beating. I mean c'mon disc golf ain't exactly a strenuous sport.

评论概述: The soles last just as long as more expensive brands.
评论详情: These shoes are very light and minimalist. I walk about 4-6 miles per day on pavement, and all brands I've tried so far all wear out in less than a year. You might as well just pay a lot less if you're going to have to replace barefoot shoes so often.  These are ultra-light and I don't recommend them for wet environments. If you put your hand in the shoe all the way to the end, you'll be able to see it through the material.  Other than that, a great buy. I have a pair for walking and another I use for the yard work.  If you like to feel the ground underneath your feat, these are the way to go.
I bought these to replace my Lems Primals. Of course they’re not as nice as Lems, but for the price, they are great shoes. This is my second pair.

For context, this is my first pair of barefoot shoes. I bought them for cross training and 15 min warm up walks outside. Received July 11th today is July 15th. They look rad, I feel rad, and the shoes are super lightweight. Fit I ordered 9.5. I wear 10.5-11 typically depending on the brand and style of shoe. I have narrow feet so I ordered about 1 size down based on the size chart and they fit great. The toe box could be a bit wider but maybe they are meant to stretch. Overall, I call it a moderately roomy toebox- not restricting but toes spread to both side when walking. Comfort Surprisingly comfortable without any real cushioning. My high arches have always caused pain unless cushioning is maxed out. No arch pain with these. Think strapping a piece of tire to the bottom of your foot- zero concerns about walking on rocks. Durability Durability is a major concern for me. I have walked 1 mile on 2 occasions and lifted weights (upper body parts) in them twice. Not much usage yet as I intentionally adjust to this type if shoe. Already, the sole has begun to separate from the shoe. For this, I will return and consider another brand. The materials used seem to be high quality but I have read other reviews that confirm I did not receive a rare lemon. This is a legit design flaw or glue quality issue that should be addressed. Summary Everything TSLA promises except for durability. 4 days and under 3 miles and they are pulling apart. I am now very excited to jump on the barefoot bandwagon just not with this brand.

类型: Color: Barefoot Trail Dark Grey & AquaSize: 10
评论详情: So I’ll just say I did end up returning these but not because they are not an AMAZING barefoot shoe. They are just too advanced of a barefoot shoe for me. I need a tad more cushion still - I’m not to this level yet. But WOW I was seriously impressed by the look, feel, and quality of this shoe. They feel really good on and look wayyyy better than the pics make them look. If you are a barefoot pro these are a must have.

I first bought these +2yrs ago for gym use, & that pair lasted me through 2yrs of workouts/walks/runs etc. When those gave out, it was a no brainer that I'd buy them again. On the first wear the sole already started to split on the side on one shoe. Now they're almost unusable but the return window is closed so I basically have to find a new pair from another brand. SUCH a  letdown

评论概述: Easily worth three times the price.
评论详情: These are quickly becoming some of my favorites and I’ve tried a LOT of different barefoot shoes over the years.  Why?  1 - I can wear them without socks. They have a good feel and don’t get too smelly either. I walk at least 10k steps in them barefoot every day and have had no problems (2 months).  2 - Fit. Some other BF shoes (cough Tolos cough) I’ve simply never enjoyed the fit. Bought two pairs REALLY wanting to like them, and they just aren’t doing it for me. I choose my TESLA kicks over TOLOS near daily. Sure, they don’t look QUITE as cool for a casual shoe, but their utility is no doubt better.  3 - Price. I’m not precious about them. I know I can beat them into the ground and then get another pair if need be. I love my Feelgrounds, but they wear out within a few months, and for $170 it’s always kind of a bummer. So I don't wear them as much cause I'm afraid I'll wear out the tread.  Can’t recommend these enough for sport + casual walking/running. They also don’t look super nerdy. Now, if they had an ALL black version or ALL white version (hint hint)…I might just use them exclusively x)

These are the best shoes I have worn in many moons! The room for my toes is the best. Not tight or overly loose. I have a better grip when I'm hiking because of the room at the front of the shoe. Going to buy another pair

评论概述: Use for probably walking for 20 days, then the sole start falling off!
评论详情: Never had worse shoes, have another shoe , same Brand, same seller, seem to hold together much better, clearly reinforced where I have problems. With only 30 days warranty don’t buy!!!

I never ever write reviews but these are just bad. I had worn these shoes for not even a full day just walking on grass and gravel and and the glue has let go on the inside of the shoe and the outer toe of the right shoe. Comfy shoes? Sure! Nice looking? Sure! I’d say the quality is that of a $10 pair of Walmart shoes but I genuinely believe the Walmart shoes would last at least a full day on my feet.

评论概述: I’ve had zero drop before but these are the first to make a slapping sound at each step
类型: Color: Barefoot Trail Dark Grey & AquaSize: 10.5
评论详情: I will start by saying that I really like them but that was only after I added the heel inserts to make them into a negative drop. The zero drop that they are with the roomie toe box makes the shoe kinda on the loose side and when walking on a department store floor, they slap. I didn’t like that. The other thing I noticed was that only after 3 wears the bend line at the front of the shoe is starting a small crack in the material. It hasn’t grown much more than in the photo after way more wears but it’s a concern. I would suggest using the inserts as I feel it makes the shoe way better. For the price you can’t beat them. I was a fan of the New Balance minimalist sneaks but they don’t seem to make the ones they use to. So far this has been the next best thing. Very true to size. I wear Vans as well in a 10-1/2 and these are the same. The fit was great.

Owned these less then a week and have worn them with limited mobility given one leg is in a boot and despite that the rubber has already torn, I suspect in a few more days this will be entirely detached from the shoe

评论详情: This is another good option as introduction to the barefoot shoe world. They don't offer a lot of support though.
Tried to wear them around the house for the day to see how they felt. Felt great. Buuuut, sole separated within a hour from the shoe.  Ended up returning.  Can’t recommend.

评论概述: First Impressions - Look Amazing But Feel Too Snug and Stiff/Scratchy
评论详情: First Impressions  I've literally just received them and only tried them on. I have not yet put them to use.  First, the red trail runners look amazing.  I really want these to work out because they look so good.  When it comes to fit and feel, I have to concur with another reviewer who notes that if you are used to wide toe box minimalist shoes, these very noticeably feel more narrow from the midsole to the ball of the foot. The toe box is wide, but the extra width doesn't extend far enough down the shoe leaving the shoe feeling "tight".  The material also feels a little stiff or scratchy out of the box compared to other shoes. I like that there is no removable insole, but the bottom of the inside of the shoe feels rough especially if you are used to not wearing socks.  Because I love the look of them so much I will be trying to wear these in to see if they will adjust to my foot and soften up a bit. If they don't I will be returning.

类型: Color: Barefoot Trail Dark Grey & AquaSize: 8

The shoes are separating from the soles. Whatever is being used to adhere them together is failing.  Bummer...
Love the shoe but not exactly a hiking shoe. Comfort was great but I wore the soles out with holes in less than a month on asphalt trails . More of a water park or light duty exercise shoe

评论概述: Best shoe to try barefoot running, hiking or gym fitness.  1/3 the price of Merrell Vapor Gloves
评论详情: I have owned barefoot shoes for almost 20 years - back to the PUMA H.Street days even before Vibram FiveFingers were only a boating shoe and long before Vivobarefoot created their first shoe.  I've owned the hand made Vivobarefoot leather dress shoes from Portugal, the original Nike Free Zero Knit shoes, the original FiveFingers 1st gen.  I've been a barefoot style runner and hiker and used just about every brand and style available.  I've been in the barefoot game since before there was a barefoot running book published (we used Pose Technique back then).  I'm just establishing myself as experienced with barefoot shoes.  So, what do I think of these Tesla "Merrell Vapor Glove" knock offs?You get what you pay for - meaning you get a $35 version of a $100 shoe.  The quality is evident in the material chosen and the workmanship.  The fabric is definitely durable and, if not abused, will last until the sole wears smooth.  That's great.  On my Tesla shoes, the glue connecting the sole to the fabric was visible in sections.  This is a $35 shoe that is well worth the investment. But the fabric also looks and feels like inexpensive nylon and not up to the same look and feel as you'll see with name brand shoes like Nike, adidas, Puma, Merrell, Vivobarefoot, etc.If I were to rank the quality of materials and workmanship with the major barefoot shoes brands selling on Amazon.... Vivobarefoot is an easy first.  Merrell is second.  Xero Shoes is third.  Whtn is fouth.  Telsa is firth.  This is not to say Tesla is junk construction. It's not.  It's just not as high quality looking - but the shoes are durable, well designed and perfect for their purpose.For 1/3 the price these Telsa barefoot shoes are perfect for someone testing out barefoot style shoes.  The thin sole, 0mm drop, and no arch support is absolutely perfect for a barefoot shoe.  These Tesla will give you a true barefoot shoe experience.If you are testing out barefoot shoes, or need a cheaper barefoot shoe for running, hiking or the gym, these are perfect.  They cost 1/3 the price of the Merrell Vapor Gloves they mimick.  As so many other reviewers have said, and as the photo shoe, these are basically Merrell Vapor Glove 3 or 4 shoes.My advice is... BUY THESE ... if you want to try barefoot running shoes for the first time or if you are an experienced barefoot runner, walker or hiker and need a sport style shoe that can withstand your workouts.At $35 these Teslas are incredibly inexpensive.  At $100 Merrell Vapor Gloves are better made, look higher quality and have a name brand.  Plus they created the design that Tesla imitated.  At $130 Xero Shoes have about the same (maybe a little less) quality than Merrell and have more choices.  At $170 Vivobarefoot are the premium barefoot shoe, used the most durable and best looking fabrics, but I wouldn't trash Vivos hiking or at the gym... not when I can use a $35 dollar shoe... or get a Merrell or Xero Shoe on sale.Click like if this review helped you. Thanks!
Comfortable and comparable to Merrill’s… but they fell apart in less than 30 days.
As hoped for! Accurate measurements, nice fit. Very squeaky sole the first use, but thankfully not for long. More roomy than my old vapor glove (3/4) which is nice. Good grip on multiple surfaces.

The entire outsole separated from the uppers after one week.  I'm a strength and conditioning coach who was looking for an alternate shoe for barefoot.  THIS IS NOT IT.  This is synonymous with throwing your money in the garbage.

评论详情: Wearing thick socks inside barefoot shoes defeats the whole purpose.  But the only way to survive the nasty prtruding stitching on the forward inside of these shoes just in front of the laces is to wear thick socks.

Even though they are not expensive they are not with it.

评论概述: Great workout shoes for weight lifting and walking
评论详情: The bottom sole is so thin, I could feel what I was stepping.  To mitigate, I glued cutouts from a thick rubber sheet purchased Amazon for $10 to reinforce the bottom sole.  It give good stability and lightweight.  Easy to pack in traveling bags.  Not made for running.  They have been excellent for walking on treadmill and other cardio machines.  I had been using New Balance Minimus zero drop shoes over a decade, but new Minimus have gotten way too expensive, so I am trying these Chinese shoes.

评论概述: New design is not done well - stick with the old style
类型: Color: Barefoot Trail Dark Grey & AquaSize: 12
评论详情: I have been buying a TSLA minimalist shoes for over 5 years now and the shoes (before this pair) have worked for me. I use them for the gym, running, and running errands/around the city. I normally get about a year of heavy use (5-6 days/week) before I wear a hole in the sole. Overall not bad for a $40 shoe.  Last month it was time for a new pair and I decided to try the new design (different lace pattern and more glued on rubber designs). This new design is NOT an improvement. After a month is use the sole and the upper on outside of the (left) shoe (along the black rubber glued-on design) started to separate. About a week later the same thing started on the outside of the right shoe. Now the shoe is starting to come unglued on the inside of the left shoe.  I gave 2 stars because the sole is the same one as the old design and I like the minimalist design plus the durability. If you are looking for a great minimalist shoe - shop this brand, but stick with the older design
These tennis are very light almost like being bear foot just enough support to work out and walk it off.GOOD deal

评论概述: You get what you pay for
评论详情: I suppose at $40 what could you really expect right ? Well apparently the reviews say otherwise. I have not even worn the shoes and I can already tell they aren't going to last long. As a $40 shoe ? Sure I suppose it's worth it if you have not worn these type of shoes before it's a good starter shoe to kind of experiment. I wouldn't buy these if I have a $100 pair at home though. I bought these accidentally in the wrong size and I don't think I'm going to exchange for my size. Quality isn't what I thought it would be (obviously for the price point it's appropriate, but the reviews claimed they were good quality long lasting shoes.)

I get that these are minimalist shoes, but they say you can use for trail running.  Not on any trails that I run.  Most have stones and rocks, and the thin soles on these offer little protection against those things.Another gripe is the proportions.  The toe box is way too big.  Perhaps that is the safe miss for a minimalist shoe.  Still, way too big.I can use these for my walks/jogs on the beach or a stroll around the block, but I won't be wearing them for any serious hiking or trail running (not that I run much anymore at 72).

评论概述: Busted in just a few weeks.
评论详情: Disappointed in the construction. In less than a few weeks of light use, the side has busted out. Expected better. Definitely not going to last as a work out / trail running shoe. They couldn't handle being glorified house slippers! 😆

Honestly wasn’t expecting much, but for the price it’s a great deal I couldn’t pass up. Fantastic minimalist shoe, and I love lifting in them. I usually buy Merrill Trail Gloves, but this is just as good so far.

评论概述: Two different lace designs - choose wisely
类型: Color: Barefoot Trail Dark Grey & AquaSize: 8.5
评论详情: I've had the original model for three years and they've been excellent and exactly what I needed. I decided to try the newer model for an updated design, but the laces now go through holes on the sides rather than through webbing along the top of the foot. For some reason, this this shoe, that lacing pattern pressed the sides of the tongue into my foot very uncomfortably. I tried to wear them around inside for a bit, but it was so uncomfortable I had to send them back.  Just replaced with the older model so that I know what to expect. Love the design of this newer model... just wish the lacing hadn't changed.

This product is broke on me the first time I took them out! Can't recommend the with this terrible quality.

After 18 months of almost daily wear, I discovered that I had worn through the interior "insole" fabric in both shoes. The soles and uppers are still in very good condition. I'm ordering replacements today, my third pair. These shoes have been great daily wear for just about everything ("just about" because there *are* occasions where something more formal is appropriate). Awesome barefoot feel, just enough protection for outdoor wear on things like large crushed rock, and the slightest bit of support without feeling like I've got something pushing my arches.
My son busted through these in a month, and he didn't over wear them.

Exceeded all expectations. Bought to replace Vivobarefoots which developed a hole in toe cap area. These are more comfortable (I do about 10k walking per day). Over 100kms of walking in them so far and extremely comfortable and no signs of wear. Went down half a size (9.5) after reading some of the comments. Tight with a sock but fine without. They are so good I bought another pair and went for true size (10) and they are perfect with a sock, so I would say true to size. Incredible value for money and they look better than Vivos. Will not be buying any of the big-name overpriced alternatives anymore.

Shoes are comfortable enough - not on par with my Merrells but acceptable. However, they are literally falling apart at the seams. This shoe fits my foot very well and I enjoy wearing it. This is a barefoot shoe with a very thin sole so you will feel all the rocks on your gravel driveway, but that is the idea of these shoes. I have worn it daily for several weeks now and it seems like it will hold up pretty well.

This shoe looks great and is well made,  but if you’ve been wearing wider footwear for any length of time, you fit will feel cramped. I’ve been in barefoot shoes for about 6 month, wearing Xero, Saguaro, Hobibear, and a few others with lower price tags, all allowing for proper toe spread. I tried wearing these for three hours and experienced quite a bit of discomfort. Also, if you are between sizes, go for the smaller of the two.

If they go half as long they were still less than half the price, so worth it.

Es justo lo que promete, el size es el habitual y se siente como estar descalzo

评论概述: Glue discoloration very visible on upper. Size down 0.5 to 1. Extra loose fabric=unapealing folds
评论详情: SIZING: recommend you size down 0.5 to 1. I usually wear 12.5 or sometimes 13 in Nike, Asics, Adidas, etc. The size 12 of these fit me correctly.  DISCOLORATION: There was a ton of visible white glue visible on the upper part of the shoe where the fabric meets the rubber/synthetic sole. There were also at least a couple spots where it apparently dripped another inch or two onto the fabric, leaving a darker stain where they may have tried to clean it up. I showed some of this in the photos (1 & 2.)  APPEARANCE - WEIRD FABRIC FOLDS: It's as if the fabric wasn't cut correctly so there is extra material piling up in weird folds. (Example in photo 3.) There are a bunch of folds the fabric on the sides of the shoe and at the top near your toes. Sometimes a lightweight fabric upper shoe can have a bit of a fold near the toes and that's normal, but these are by far the worst I've seen and include a bunch of folds on the sides.  COLOR: Last nitpick is these are labeled as green on both Amazon and the packaging, but are clearly very blue in person and on the Amazon photo. There's a little bit of teal, but nobody would call this green. The photo is pretty accurate so I wasn't surprised. These should just be labeled as blue.  COMFORT: Overall the comfort was okay, but I've tried several other similar priced, competing lightweight shoes on Amazon (Whitin and Orangineer for example) and I liked this shoe the least. The wide toe area is indeed nice. Usually my big toe feels cramped in normal shoes.
Fit is great!

I have had pains for years with running and going from one shoe to the next. The first time I took these shoes on a hike and run I was feeling amazing and pain free. This might not be for everyone but if you've been trying shoes for years and can't find one that works. This shoe is worth a try.

One shoe is separating at the sole on the outside edge and the other on the inside.  They were great for uh 40 days daily wear…. A dollar a day.  Going to try the merrels next for 30 bucks more (close to double price).  Hopes to get closer to a year.
It's not as comfortable as expected. Just wanted my time looking for barefoot and ended up buying this.

This is my first entry into a pair of minimalist/barefoot type shoe and so far I like it. I normally wear a 10.5 wide but since there are no 1/2 sizes the recommendation was that I order an 11. They're a good .5" too long but the width is good with the toe width being roomy and my toes feeling relaxed and not pinched together. One of the things I couldn't find before buying was the weight of these shoes. Each one is 209g, about 100g lighter than my usual running Asics shoes. I Iike feeling the terrain under my feet but like having some protection for my soles. These are very comfortable. Running in these is a little different in that I'm more on the front of my foot and my calves can really tell the difference. I only use them for running and only have about 15 miles on them so far and I'm curious how they'll hold up but do far so good.

评论概述: They didn’t fit right.  10.5 was too small, 11 too big (long)
评论详情: I really wanted to like these, but I found the 10.5 was too small (short) and the 11 too big (long).  The width was fine, and I have a wide foot.  I normally wear Merrills so these appealed to me.  I thought they looked good.  Had they fit, I would have kept them.  I’m not sure what the issue is - other than my foot.  LOL.  They may be perfect for you.  I just found the 11 to be oddly long, with a bunch of toe space.
not like I thought they would be

2 weeks after the return window closed I discovered that the plastic moulding that is connects the sole to the toe area of the shoe body has cracked and the glue has given out.  Only wore for light use in the gym. Never trails or outside the gym.  Pretty disappointed. Money better spent elsewhere.

评论概述: Comfortable for walking but not for running. yet?
评论详情: Thin sole shoes allow/cause your feet to feel every bump and crack on the ground. Hard at first to get used to heavy heel impact and ankle/shin muscle strain when walking on concrete (parking lot, walking trails, tile floor) but OK now.  If just starting out or going to wear them all day then cover your regular sock with a second ankle-high sock 1/2 way up just past the heel... then, with 3-4 inches still hanging past the toes, fold the remaining sock length flat under your arch and possibly heel. Will add a little softness and will also help shoes fit snugly until feet are used to them.
I like feeling of walking barefooted and connected to the ground. That’s the reason that I bought this one. I’m transitioning to barefoot shoes.

Used for walking concrete and groomed trail. Toe box detailing started cracking after second use. Full blown holes in fabric upper and separation from sole after 5th time out. Don't waste time with this shoe.

I recently purchased the TSLA zero-drop barefoot shoes, being a fan of this type of footwear. My excitement quickly turned to disappointment during my first run. Barely a mile in, I felt a sharp pain on the top of my right foot. Upon inspecting, I discovered that the shoe had caused a wound.  The primary issue seems to stem from a hard layer in the shoe's design, which is surprisingly aggressive against the skin, even with socks on. This is quite concerning as the fundamental purpose of running shoes is to provide comfort and support during physical activities. Unfortunately, this model failed to deliver on both fronts.  I wanted to love these shoes, but I cannot recommend them due to the discomfort and injury they caused. Potential buyers should be aware of this flaw and consider it when making their decision.

评论概述: 1 Size Too Big, Roomy Toe Box
评论详情: The shoes are big.  I usually wear 12 1/2 but there was none so I bought size 13 and they are too big.  12s would probably work.  Very light and large toe box.  The sole is thin so don’t step on stones.  Also the black camo does not look anything like the pictures; it is just a series of horizontal lines.  If they hold up they are well worth the price.  REVISION:  After checking, I discovered AMAZON sent the wrong shoes,  that is why they don't look like camo.  Even the black shoes I received do not match the black shown on the Amazon site.  I probably received an old pair no longer in production.
